org.digijava.kernel.validation

Interface ConstraintValidator

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    AgreementCodeValidator, ComponentFundingOrgRoleValidator, ConditionalRequiredValidator, FundingWithTransactionsValidator, ImplementationLevelValidator, MultiStakeholderPartnershipValidator, NumberRangeValidator, OnBudgetValidator, PledgeOrgValidator, PrivateResourceValidator, ProgramMappingValidator, RegexValidator, RegionLocationValidator, RequiredValidator, ResourceRequiredValidator, SizeValidator, TotalPercentageValidator, TreeCollectionValidator, UniqueActivityTitleValidator, UniqueValidator

    public interface ConstraintValidator
    Validates if the value satisfies one or more constraints. Note: Constraint validators are expected to validate one constraint at a time and the API is geared towards that. However via context parameter, validator can report many constraint violations for different constraints, though not advisable to do so. Ideally, context parameter must be used only when many values fail to satisfy the same constraint, and a constraint violation is needed for each invalid value.

    • Method Detail

      • initialize

        void initialize(java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> arguments)
        Initialize the constraint validator.
        Parameters:
        arguments - arguments for the constraint validator

      • isValid

        boolean isValid(APIField type,
                java.lang.Object value,
                ConstraintValidatorContext context)
        Validate the value and return true if the object is valid. Otherwise return false. If validator has to report multiple constraint violations at once, context parameter can be used to override default constraint violation creation mechanism. Constraint validator defined at class level will always be invoked with a non-null value. Note: Because the meta model is represented just as list of fields, here validator accepts the field in order to have access to type information. Validators must not use field name because APIField will be replaced with a different class.
        Parameters:
        type - type information about the object
        value - value to be validated
        context - constraint validation context for the current invocation
        Returns:
        true if the value is valid

      • getErrorMessage

        ApiErrorMessage getErrorMessage()
        Returns the error message to use when creating default constraint violations.
        Returns:
        error message
